- Row 1: Auckland, New Zealand
- Row 2: Kiawah Island, South Carolina, USA
- Row 3: Cape Town, South Africa
- Rows 4 to 6: Shenzhen, China; Dorado, Puerto Rico; Orlando, Florida, USA

Ah, yes. Cape Town is listed in row index 3 with the year 1996. So according to the table, the tournament was held in Cape Town in 1996, not 1998.

Wait, but the claim says it was first held in Cape Town in 1998. That would mean that before 1998, it wasn't held there. However, looking at row 3 (year 1996), Cape Town is already a location. So if 1996 has Cape Town as the location, then 1998 can't be the first time.
